info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and central Windsor Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 141 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mt. Holly, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Barnard, Woodstock Village, Mount Holly, Shrewsbury, Wallingford, Mt. Holly, Plymouth, Bridgewater, Reading, Ludlow, Hartland, Killington, Pomfret, Mount Tabor, Royalton, West Windsor, Cavendish, Stockbridge and Mendon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
